alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Panola; Tallahatchie (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 06 at 6:10AM CDT until April 07 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: .Persistent light to moderate rainfall overnight has caused ponding of water on roads. Creeks and streams have have risen and may be near bankfull. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following counties, Lafayette, Marshall, Panola, Tallahatchie and Yalobusha. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since Midnight. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxford, Water Valley, Charleston, Holly Springs National Forest, George Payne State Park, Pope, Burgess, Springdale, Harmontown, Cambridge, Enid, Bethlehem, Oakland, Courtland, Abbeville, Taylor, College Hill, Shuford, College Hill Station and Teckville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
